content: Send the password change instructions to the <1>{{email}}</1> email address

comment.text: This translation key is used to display a message instructing users on what action to take next after changing their password. It appears in a modal dialog header, prompting users to send password change instructions to a specified email address.

usage.context:
>
 <ModalDialog.Header>{t("PasswordChangeTitle")}</ModalDialog.Header>
 <ModalDialog.Body>
 <Text fontSize="13px">
 <Trans
 i18nKey="MessageSendPasswordChangeInstructionsOnEmail"
 ns="ChangePasswordDialog"
 t={t}
 >
 Send the password change instructions to the
 <Link

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The angle brackets '<1>{{email}}</1>' are not correctly closed in the Arabic translation. It should mirror the English format.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: أرسل تعليمات تغيير كلمة المرور إلى عنوان البريد الإلكتروني <1>{{email}}</1>

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The email address placeholder `{{email}}` is not properly enclosed within the email address to form a complete sentence.  It is positioned at the beginning of the sentence.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Şifrənin dəyişdirilməsi haqqında təlimatı <1>{{email}}</1> ünvanına göndər

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The translation 'Anleitungen zur Änderung eines Passworts' is too literal and clunky. A more natural translation would be something like 'Passwort-Zurücksetzungshinweise'.

The phrase 'Anleitungen zur Änderung eines Passworts' translates more literally to "Instructions for changing a password." The English phrasing uses a more idiomatic expression 'password change instructions'.
The Greek translation maintains the HTML tags <1> and </1> which should be removed for a clean display in a user interface.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Αποστολή οδηγιών αλλαγής κωδικού πρόσβασης στο {{email}}

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The French translation "Envoyer le mot de passe à <1>{{email}}</1>" incorrectly translates "Send the password change instructions to...". It states "Send the password to...", which is inaccurate.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Envoyer les instructions de modification de mot de passe à <1>{{email}}</1>

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The French translation lacks consistency in the use of HTML tags. The English version uses <1> and </1>.  While the French uses <1> and </1>, it's important to ensure they match for consistency. A more idiomatic translation might not require these tags at all.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Consider removing or adjusting the HTML tags for better alignment with English original or French conventions. The best approach would depend on how the tags are actually used.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The HTML tag `<1>` appears to be used inconsistently. It's present in both the English and Armenian strings. While not inherently an error, it's worth confirming if this is intentional and how it is used in the UI.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Confirm the intended functionality and placement of the `<1>` tags. If they are placeholders for variable insertion, ensure consistency in their usage and meaning across locales.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The HTML tag <1> is inconsistent. English uses <1>{{email}}</1> while Japanese uses the same. While functionally it may not matter, maintaining consistency is preferred.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Consider standardizing the HTML tag to <1>{{email}}</1> across both languages, or remove the tags entirely.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The Korean translation '비밀번호 변경 방법이 <1>{{email}}</1>으로 전송되었습니다' translates to 'Password change method has been sent to <1>{{email}}</1>'. The English says 'Send the password change instructions to...'. The Korean implies the method *has* been sent, rather than stating that it is being sent. It's also slightly awkward phrasing.
The Korean translation maintains the <1>{{email}}</1> tag which is correct but the way it's used could be more natural. It feels somewhat literal.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Consider adjusting the sentence structure to seamlessly incorporate the email address. The current structure feels like a direct translation of the tag, which may not be ideal for natural Korean.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The phrase "ຄຳແນະນຳກ່ຽວກັບການປ່ຽນລະຫັດຜ່ານ" is a bit literal and can be improved for natural Lao. A more natural phrasing would be something like "ການຊື້ງຄຳແນະນຳການປ່ຽນລະຫັດຜ່ານ" or "ອີເມວຂອງການປ່ຽນລະຫັດຜ່ານ".
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: ອີເມວຂອງການປ່ຽນລະຫັດຜ່ານໄປທີ່ <1>{{email}}</1>

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The `<1>` tags are inconsistent between the English and Polish versions. The English version uses `<1>` while the Polish one does as well.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Ensure consistent tag usage across languages (e.g., `<1>` in both).

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The translation 'Envie as instruções de alteração de palavra-passe para o <1>{{email}}</1>' is not the most natural or common phrasing in Portuguese. 'Palavra-passe' is technically correct, but 'senha' is far more common for 'password'. A better translation would incorporate that.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Envie as instruções de alteração de senha para o <1>{{email}}</1>

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The translation 'මුරපදය වෙනස් කිරීමේ උපදෙස්' translates to 'password change instructions' which is accurate. However, the phrasing 'වි-තැපැල් ලිපිනයට යවන්න' could be more natural. It literally translates to 'send to email address'. A more common phrasing would be 'ඔබේ වි-තැපැල් ලිපිනයට යවන්න' (send to your email address) or simply 'ඔබට වි-තැපැල් යවන්න' (send email).

The translation 'Пошаљите упутства за промену лозинке на' is a literal translation of 'Send the password change instructions to'. A more natural Serbian phrasing would be something like 'Шаљите инструкције за промену лозинке на'.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Шаљите инструкције за промену лозинке на

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The code tags `<1>{{email}}</1>` are not standard in Serbian. The proper way to represent the variable is `<1>{{email}}</1>.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: No change needed. Tag formatting is correct.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The translation 'Pošaljite uputstva za promenu lozinke na <1>{{email}}</1> email adresu' is a literal translation and can be improved for naturalness in Serbian. A more common phrasing would be 'Pošaljite instrukcije za promenu lozinke na <1>{{email}}</1> email adresu.' or 'Pošaljite uputstva za resetovanje lozinke na <1>{{email}}</1> email adresu'.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Pošaljite instrukcije za promenu lozinke na <1>{{email}}</1> email adresu.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The translation "将密码更改指示发送至<1>{{email}}</1>" is overly literal and not natural in Chinese. A more natural phrasing would be something along the lines of "密码重置链接已发送至<1>{{email}}</1>" or "我们已将密码重置链接发送至<1>{{email}}</1>".  '指示' (instructions) is awkward.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: 密码重置链接已发送至<1>{{email}}</1>
